intro: Chisocheton apoensis, commonly known as the Apo tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to the Philippines, specifically found in the mountainous regions of the southern part of the country. The tree can grow up to 20 meters tall, with a straight trunk and a broad, spreading crown. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and ovate, while the flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences. The fruit is a woody capsule that contains several seeds.
